definition: to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 300 sentences, you can make a living in America.
sentences.chinese: 脫口而出300句英語，你可以在美國工作。

sentences.english: If we had another name for this meat, people wouldn't even think twice.
sentences.chinese: 你若問起這種肉的別名，人們想都不想就會脫口而出。

sentences.english: The whole idea evolved from a casual remark.
sentences.chinese: 整個想法是由一句脫口而出的話演變而來的。

sentences.english: Every day I am blurting out more sentences.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，我都在脫口而出更多的句子。

sentences.english: Emotional when the mirror will be almost blurted out the true identity of the Ming house.
sentences.chinese: 情緒激動之時，明鏡險些將明樓的真實身份脫口而出。

sentences.english: Julia blurted out by accident. “I never imagined you being a doctor!”
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亞脫口而出，“我還真不知道你還是個醫生。”

sentences.english: The world is tired of the death blurting out or muttering again and again.
sentences.chinese: 世界厭倦透了脫口而出或再三沉吟的死亡。

sentences.english: HATE liver and cheese, " blurts the Golden Retriever."
sentences.chinese: 我恨肝臟和奶酪，“脫口而出的金毛尋回犬。

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 500 sentences, you can be a successful international businessman.
sentences.chinese: 脫口而出500句英語，你可以成爲成功的國際商人。
我不假思索地脫口而出。

sentences.english: Finally I blurted my name out.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我的名字脫口而出。

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 100 sentences, you can survive in America.
sentences.chinese: 脫口而出100句英語，你可以在美國生活。

sentences.english: " he burst out, exasperatedly."Do you expect me to drag him back?
sentences.chinese: 他怒氣衝衝地脫口而出，”你想我把它拖回去？
你能不假思索的脫口而出嗎？

sentences.english: B： I just practiced blurting out useful sentences every day for one year.
sentences.chinese: 我只是用了一年的時間每天練習脫口而出有用的句子。

sentences.english: The excuses pop out of their mouth non-stop.
sentences.chinese: 理由總是不斷脫口而出。

definition: (of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
